vLanCurrentNumber.name: vLanCurrentNumber
vLanCurrentNumber.description: The current instance of Virtual LAN which corresponds to vLanNumber in object type vLanEntry. All the Bridging, Spanning Tree, and interface parameters refered thereafter will be referenced from this instance only. Default value upon the OmniSwitch power up is 1. It must be set to the desired value before any access to the rest of the virtual LAN system.

vLanTable.name: vLanTable
vLanTable.description: A list of Virtual LAN instances in this physical OmniSwitch.

vLanNumber.name: vLanNumber
vLanNumber.description: The VLAN number identifying this instance. Valid range from 1 to 65535.

vLanBridgeAddress.name: vLanBridgeAddress
vLanBridgeAddress.description: The MAC address used by the instance of VLAN which specified in vLanCurrentNumber when it must be referred to in a unique fashion. It is recommended that this be the numerically smallest MAC address of all ports that belong to this VLAN. However it is only required to be unique. When concatenated with vStpPriority a unique BridgeIdentifier is formed which is used in the Spanning Tree Protocol.

vLanBridgeType.name: vLanBridgeType
vLanBridgeType.description: Indicates what type of bridging this VLAN can perform. If a VLAN is actually performing a certain type of bridging this will be indicated by entries in the port table for the given type.

vLanDescription.name: vLanDescription
vLanDescription.description: Textual description of the VLAN instance.

vLanAdmStatus.name: vLanAdmStatus
vLanAdmStatus.description: The administrative status which can be set by configuration. Disable(1) will disable ALL vports that are connected to this VLAN, enable(2) will enable ALL ports on this VLAN, delete(3) will dettach and delete the ports/routers AND remove the VLAN.

vLanOperStatus.name: vLanOperStatus
vLanOperStatus.description: Provide operating status of a particular VLAN environment.

vLanMode.name: vLanMode
vLanMode.description: Provides special operating mode setup and status. Currently this object is used to specify weather the VLAN supports the standard or ATM CIP connections.

vLanFloodOverride.name: vLanFloodOverride
vLanFloodOverride.description: Provides the flood limit value for all virtual ports that belong to the specied VLAN. The number is given in bytes per second. -1 and 0 have a special meaning. -1 means use the default or configured flood limit for each virtual port that belongs to the specified VLAN. 0 disables flood limiting on all virtual ports that belong to the specifed VLAN.

vLanRouterAddress.name: vLanRouterAddress
vLanRouterAddress.description: The user-configured MAC address used by the the VLAN's router port (IP / IPX). If this value has not been configured, the value returned is zero and this VLAN's router port will use a factory provided default value. The address should be specified in canonical order.

vLanMobileGroup.name: vLanMobileGroup
vLanMobileGroup.description: If set to enabled, makes this a mobile group. If set to disabled, makes this a non-mobile gropu.

vLanAuthGroup.name: vLanAuthGroup
vLanAuthGroup.description: If set to enable, makes this a authenticated group. If set to disable, makes this a non-authenticated group. For it to be set to enable, the group should be a mobile group.

vLanAuthGroupProtocol.name: vLanAuthGroupProtocol
vLanAuthGroupProtocol.description: If a NULL string is returned as the value, this object is not applicable to that group. The contents of the string can interpreted based on the first byte. if the first byte is 1, the protocol is IP ( for all encaps ). 2, the protocol is IPX 3, the protocol is DECNET 4, the protocol is APPLETALK 5, the protocol is specified as an Ether-Type value with the next two bytes indicating the ether-type value, for e.g banyan vines ether-type will be specified as 08 0B AD 6, the protocol is specified using dsap and ssap values with the next two bytes giving the dsap and ssap value respectively, for e.g for banyan vines llc encap, it would look like 09 BC BC. 7, the protocol is specified using snap header with the next 5 bytes indicating the snap header for that protocol. For e.g if banyan vines snap has to be specified, it would look like, 0A 00 00 00 80 C4. FF, for all protocols.

vLanStpStatus.name: vLanStpStatus
vLanStpStatus.description: Indicates status of spanning tree for the current VLAN.

vLanBrdgTpExtendedAgeingTime.name: vLanBrdgTpExtendedAgeingTime
vLanBrdgTpExtendedAgeingTime.description: The AutoTracker extended ageing timer. This value indicates how long the switch will remember the mac address and its associated vlan information. The default value is 1200 secs. This means that the mac information will be remembered for (vLanBrdgTpExtendedAgeingTime - vBrdgTpAgingTime) seconds after the mac is aged out. This value must be set to a value greater than or equal to vBrdgTpAgingTime.

vLanPriority.name: vLanPriority
vLanPriority.description: This is the priority of the given VLAN. It can be any one level from 0 to 7 with 0 being the lowest and 7 being the highest

vLanNextFreeNumber.name: vLanNextFreeNumber
vLanNextFreeNumber.description: This is the next unused VLAN number. Typically this will be used to create a new VLAN with the next highest number.

vIPRouterTable.name: vIPRouterTable
vIPRouterTable.description: A list of Virtual Router instances in this physical OmniSwitch.

vIPRouterVLan.name: vIPRouterVLan
vIPRouterVLan.description: VLAN ID for this vIPRouterEntry instance.

vIPRouterProtocol.name: vIPRouterProtocol
vIPRouterProtocol.description: The routing protocol(s) for this virtual router port. Each IP router port can carry one or more routing protocols. This will be represented by the logical ORing of each protocol number. Which are: ipOther(1), ipRip(2), ipEgp(4), ipGgp(8), ipHello(16), ipIs-is(32), ipEs-is(64), ipCiscoIgrp(128), ipBbnSpfIgp(256), ipOigp(512)

vIPRouterNetAddress.name: vIPRouterNetAddress
vIPRouterNetAddress.description: The IP network address for this virtual bridge instance for the purpose of allowing access from the external network management system.

vIPRouterSubNetMask.name: vIPRouterSubNetMask
vIPRouterSubNetMask.description: The IP network subnet mask for this virtual bridge instance for the purpose of allowing access from the external network management system.

vIPRouterBcastAddress.name: vIPRouterBcastAddress
vIPRouterBcastAddress.description: The IP broadcast address for this virtual bridge instance for the purpose of allowing access from the external network management system.

vIPRouterDescription.name: vIPRouterDescription
vIPRouterDescription.description: Textual description of the router instance.

vIPRouterAdmStatus.name: vIPRouterAdmStatus
vIPRouterAdmStatus.description: The particular routing environment can be enable(2) or disable(1) (or delete (3)) upon user's request.

vIPRouterOperStatus.name: vIPRouterOperStatus
vIPRouterOperStatus.description: Provide operating status of a particular router envirnment.

vIPRouterFramingType.name: vIPRouterFramingType
vIPRouterFramingType.description: Provides the ability to set the outbound frame type for IP traffic. The default frame type is Ethernet 2. If the frame type is incompatible with the transmitting media, appropriate translation will be performed at egress.

vIPRouterRipConfigMode.name: vIPRouterRipConfigMode
vIPRouterRipConfigMode.description: RIP's operational mode. 'silent' means that RIP listens for routing updates but does not send them. 'deaf' means that RIP sends routing updates but not listen to them. 'active' means that RIP both sends and receives routing updates, and 'inactive' means that RIP is not operational on the given virtual LAN. The default is 'simple'.

vIPRouterRelayTable.name: vIPRouterRelayTable
vIPRouterRelayTable.description: A list of UDP Relay Service instances.

vIPRouterRelayService.name: vIPRouterRelayService
vIPRouterRelayService.description: This specifies the UDP Relay Service to be forwarded.

vIPRouterRelayMode.name: vIPRouterRelayMode
vIPRouterRelayMode.description: This controls whether the internal UDP Relay service is enabled or disabled. When enabled, the service will forward packets to a specified server (or specified broadcast address.) or VLAN. Note that for BOOTP/DHCP service, unless the relay's next hop ip address (vIPRouterRelayForwAddr) is set to a valid value, it will not possible to enable the relay. For other services, a VLAN to forwared to (vIPRouterRelayForwVlan in vIPRouterRelayForwTable) or a next hop ip address must be set. The mode definitions are as follows: 1 - enabled 2 - configureRequest 3 - underConfiguration 4 - disabled A manager will set the state to configureRequest(2) before attempting to configure any other parameters for a particular UPD Service. The agent will then set the state to underConfiguration(3). When in the underConfiguration(3) state, a UDP service is not completely configured and will remain in this state until the management station is finished configuring and sets the state to either enabled(1) or disabled(4). A manager is restricted to changing the state of an entry in the following ways: config under To: valid Request config invalid From: valid OK NO OK OK configRequest N/A N/A N/A N/A underConfig OK NO OK OK invalid NO OK NO OK

vIPRouterRelayNextHop.name: vIPRouterRelayNextHop
vIPRouterRelayNextHop.description: This sets the relay's forwarding address. It can either be set to a distinct IP address (e.g. the address of a server), to an IP broadcast address or a VLAN.

vIPRouterRelayParam1.name: vIPRouterRelayParam1
vIPRouterRelayParam1.description: This sets the BOOTP/DHCP relay's maximum hops forwarding limit. If a BOOT/DHCP frame arrives with hopcount greater than or equal to vIPRouterRelayParam1, it will be dropped. For BOOTP/DHCP the legal range is 1..16. For Generic services, this sets the port number to be forwarded. The legal range is -1..65535 with -1 indicating the unset state.

vIPRouterRelayParam2.name: vIPRouterRelayParam2
vIPRouterRelayParam2.description: This sets the BOOTP/DHCP relay's forwarding delay and is only used by the BOOTP/DHCP service. For other services it is ignored. It is typically set as seconds, but the value is totally client dependent. The relay will not forward frames until client frames have 'secs' field set to at least the value of vIPRouterRelayParam2.

vIPRouterRelayDescription.name: vIPRouterRelayDescription
vIPRouterRelayDescription.description: This sets the service description for generic services. For other services, the description is fixed and may only be read.

vIPXRouterTable.name: vIPXRouterTable
vIPXRouterTable.description: A list of Virtual Router instances in this physical OmniSwitch.

vIPXRouterVLan.name: vIPXRouterVLan
vIPXRouterVLan.description: VLAN ID for this vIPXRouterEntry instance.

vIPXRouterProtocol.name: vIPXRouterProtocol
vIPXRouterProtocol.description: The routing protocol(s) for this virtual router port. Each IPX router port can carry one or more routing protocols. This will be represented by the logical ORing of each protocol number. Which are: ipxNone(1), ipxRipOnly(2), ipxRipAndSap(3), ipxTriggered(4)

vIPXRouterNetAddress.name: vIPXRouterNetAddress
vIPXRouterNetAddress.description: The IPX network address for this virtual bridge.

vIPXRouterFramingType.name: vIPXRouterFramingType
vIPXRouterFramingType.description: Provides the ability to set the outbound frame type for IPX traffic. The default frame type is 802.2 Novell Raw. If the frame type is incompatible with the transmitting media, appropriate translation will be performed at egress.

vIPXRouterDescription.name: vIPXRouterDescription
vIPXRouterDescription.description: Textual description of the router instance.

vIPXRouterAdmStatus.name: vIPXRouterAdmStatus
vIPXRouterAdmStatus.description: The particular routing environment can be enabled(2) or disabled(1) upon user's request.

vIPXRouterOperStatus.name: vIPXRouterOperStatus
vIPXRouterOperStatus.description: Provide operating status of a particular router environment.

vIPXSrcRteType.name: vIPXSrcRteType
vIPXSrcRteType.description: Provide the ability to set the type of source routing broadcasts between AllRoutesExplorer(0) and SpanningTreeExplorer(1).

vBrdgTpLearnEntryDiscards.name: vBrdgTpLearnEntryDiscards
vBrdgTpLearnEntryDiscards.description: The total number of Forwarding Database entries, which have been or would have been learnt, but have been discarded due to a lack of space to store them in the Forwarding Database. If this counter is increasing, it indicates that the Forwarding Database is regularly becoming full (a condition which has unpleasant performance effects on the subnetwork). If this counter has a significant value but is not presently increasing, it indicates that the problem has been occurring but is not persistent.

vBrdgTpAgingTime.name: vBrdgTpAgingTime
vBrdgTpAgingTime.description: The timeout period in seconds for aging out dynamically learned forwarding information. 802.1D-1990 recommends a default of 300 seconds.

vBrdgTpFdbTable.name: vBrdgTpFdbTable
vBrdgTpFdbTable.description: A table that contains information about unicast entries for which the bridge has forwarding and/or filtering information. This information is used by the transparent bridging function within its VLAN in determining how to propagate a received frame.

vBrdgTpFdbEntry.name: vBrdgTpFdbEntry
vBrdgTpFdbEntry.description: Information about a specific unicast MAC address for which the VLAN bridge has some forwarding and/or filtering information.

vBrdgTpFdbAddress.name: vBrdgTpFdbAddress
vBrdgTpFdbAddress.description: A unicast MAC address for which the VLAN bridge has forwarding and/or filtering information.

vBrdgTpFdbRcvPortSlot.name: vBrdgTpFdbRcvPortSlot
vBrdgTpFdbRcvPortSlot.description: The slot number of the port that vBrdgTpFdbAddress is received.

vBrdgTpFdbRcvPortIF.name: vBrdgTpFdbRcvPortIF
vBrdgTpFdbRcvPortIF.description: The on-board interface number of the port that vBrdgTpFdbAddress is received.

vBrdgTpFdbRcvPortFuncTyp.name: vBrdgTpFdbRcvPortFuncTyp
vBrdgTpFdbRcvPortFuncTyp.description: The service type of the port that vBrdgTpFdbAddress is received.

vBrdgTpFdbRcvPortFuncTypInst.name: vBrdgTpFdbRcvPortFuncTypInst
vBrdgTpFdbRcvPortFuncTypInst.description: The service type instance of the port that vBrdgTpFdbAddress is received.

vBrdgTpFdbRcvStatus.name: vBrdgTpFdbRcvStatus
vBrdgTpFdbRcvStatus.description: The status of this entry. Xylan does not support other(1) and self(4). The meanings of the values are: invalid(2) : this entry is no longer valid, but has not yet been flushed from the table. learned(3) : this entry has been learned. mgmt(5) : this entry is configured as a static entry.

vBrdgTpFdbRcvVLANMembership.name: vBrdgTpFdbRcvVLANMembership
vBrdgTpFdbRcvVLANMembership.description: The Auto-Tracker VLAN membership for this device. Each bit that is set in this objects 32 bit value indicates that the device is part of the VLAN given by that bits position.

vBrdgTpFdbDupStatus.name: vBrdgTpFdbDupStatus
vBrdgTpFdbDupStatus.description: The variable indicates if vBrdgTpFdbAddress is a duplicate Mac.

vBrdgTpFdbLastSeenTime.name: vBrdgTpFdbLastSeenTime
vBrdgTpFdbLastSeenTime.description: The time since, the specific unicast MAC address for which the VLAN bridge has forwarding information was last seen.

vBrdgStaticTable.name: vBrdgStaticTable
vBrdgStaticTable.description: A table contains source addresses which can be configured to stay permanent (not aging out) in the Forwarding table.

vBrdgStaticEntry.name: vBrdgStaticEntry
vBrdgStaticEntry.description: Information about a specific unicast MAC address for which the VLAN bridge has VLAN information.

vBrdgStaticAddress.name: vBrdgStaticAddress
vBrdgStaticAddress.description: The MAC address which the static status applies.

vBrdgStaticPortSlot.name: vBrdgStaticPortSlot
vBrdgStaticPortSlot.description: The slot number of the port that vBrdgStaticAddress applies. Entering this entry allows the MAC address to set in this port. If this entry is provided, vBrdgStaticPortIF, vBrdgStaticPortFuncTyp and vBrdgStaticPortFuncTypInst must also be set.

vBrdgStaticPortIF.name: vBrdgStaticPortIF
vBrdgStaticPortIF.description: The on-board interface of the port that vBrdgStaticAddress applies. Entering this entry allows the MAC address to set in this port. If this entry is set, vBrdgStaticPortSlot, vBrdgStaticPortFuncTyp and vBrdgStaticPortFuncTypInst must also be set.

vBrdgStaticPortFuncTyp.name: vBrdgStaticPortFuncTyp
vBrdgStaticPortFuncTyp.description: The service type of the port that vBrdgStaticAddress applies. Entering this entry allows the MAC address to set in this port. If this entry is set, vBrdgStaticPortSlot, vBrdgStaticPortIF and vBrdgStaticPortFuncTypInst must also be set.

vBrdgStaticPortFuncTypInst.name: vBrdgStaticPortFuncTypInst
vBrdgStaticPortFuncTypInst.description: The service type instance of the port that vBrdgStaticAddress applies. Entering this entry allows the MAC address to set in this port. If this entry is set, vBrdgStaticPortSlot, vBrdgStaticPortIF and vBrdgStaticPortFuncTyp must also be set.

vBrdgStaticStatus.name: vBrdgStaticStatus
vBrdgStaticStatus.description: This object indicates the status of this entry. Xylan does not support other(1). The default value is permenent(3). invalid(2) - writing this value to the object removes the entry. permanent(3) - this entry will never age out and remain even after next reset. deleteOnReset(4) - this entry will not age out until reset. deleteOnTimeout(5) - write this value to the entry will cause it to age out.

vBrdgTpATVLANAgeingTime.name: vBrdgTpATVLANAgeingTime
vBrdgTpATVLANAgeingTime.description: The AutoTracker extended ageing timer. This value indicates how long the switch will remember the mac address and its associated vlan information. The default value is 1200 secs. This means that the mac information will be remembered for (vBrdgTpATVLANAgeingTime - vBrdgTpAgingTime) seconds after the mac is aged out. This value must be set to a value greater than or equal to vBrdgTpAgingTime.

vStpProtocolSpecification.name: vStpProtocolSpecification
vStpProtocolSpecification.description: The version of the Spanning Tree Protocol implemented for the Xylan products. The IEE 802.1d implementation is the only version supported. If future versions of the IEEE Spanning Tree Protocol are released that are incompatible with the current version a new value will be defined.

vStpPriority.name: vStpPriority
vStpPriority.description: The value of the write-able portion of the Bridge ID, i.e., the first two octets of the (8 octet long) Bridge ID. The other (last) 6 octets of the Bridge ID are given by the value of vLanBridgeAddress.

vStpBridgeAddress.name: vStpBridgeAddress
vStpBridgeAddress.description: The bridge identifier of this VLAN of the spanning tree as determined by the Spanning Tree Protocol as executed by this VLAN.

vStpTimeSinceTopologyChange.name: vStpTimeSinceTopologyChange
vStpTimeSinceTopologyChange.description: The time (in hundredths of a second) since the last time a topology change was detected by the VLAN bridge entity.

vStpTopChanges.name: vStpTopChanges
vStpTopChanges.description: The total number of topology changes detected by this VLAN bridge since the management entity was last reset or initialized.

vStpDesignatedRoot.name: vStpDesignatedRoot
vStpDesignatedRoot.description: The bridge identifier of the root of the spanning tree as determined by the Spanning Tree Protocol as executed by this VLAN. This value is used as the Root Identifier parameter in all Configuration Bridge PDUs originated by this node.

vStpRootCost.name: vStpRootCost
vStpRootCost.description: The cost of the path to the root as seen from this VLAN bridge.

vStpRootPortSlot.name: vStpRootPortSlot
vStpRootPortSlot.description: The slot number of the port which offers the lowest cost path from this VLAN bridge to the root bridge.

vStpRootPortIF.name: vStpRootPortIF
vStpRootPortIF.description: The on-board interface of the port which offers the lowest cost path from this VLAN bridge to the root bridge.

vStpRootPortFuncTyp.name: vStpRootPortFuncTyp
vStpRootPortFuncTyp.description: The service type of the port which offers the lowest cost path from this VLAN bridge to the root bridge.

vStpRootPortFuncTypInst.name: vStpRootPortFuncTypInst
vStpRootPortFuncTypInst.description: The service type instance of the port which offers the lowest cost path from this VLAN bridge to the root bridge.

vStpMaxAge.name: vStpMaxAge
vStpMaxAge.description: The maximum age of Spanning Tree Protocol information learned from the network on any port before it is discarded, in units of hundredths of a second. This is the actual value that this bridge is currently using.

vStpHelloTime.name: vStpHelloTime
vStpHelloTime.description: The amount of time between the transmission of Configuration bridge PDUs by this VLAN on any port when it is the root of the spanning tree or trying to become so, in units of hundredths of a second. This is the actual value that this VLAN is currently using.

vStpHoldTime.name: vStpHoldTime
vStpHoldTime.description: This time value determines the interval length during which no more than two Configuration bridge PDUs shall be transmitted by this VLAN, in units of hundredths of a second.

vStpForwardDelay.name: vStpForwardDelay
vStpForwardDelay.description: This time value, measured in units of hundredths of a second, controls how fast a port changes its spanning state when moving towards the Forwarding state. The value determines how long the port stays in each of the Listening and Learning states, which precede the Forwarding state. This value is also used, when a topology change has been detected and is underway, to age all dynamic entries in the Forwarding Database. [Note that this value is the one that this bridge is currently using, in contrast to vStpBridgeForwardDelay which is the value that this VLAN and all others would start using if/when this bridge were to become the root.]

vStpBridgeMaxAge.name: vStpBridgeMaxAge
vStpBridgeMaxAge.description: The value that all bridges use for MaxAge when this VLAN is acting as the root. Note that 802.1D-1990 specifies that the range for this parameter is related to the value of vStpBridgeHelloTime. The granularity of this timer is specified by 802.1D-1990 to be 1 second. An agent may return a badValue error if a set is attempted to a value which is not a whole number of seconds.

vStpBridgeHelloTime.name: vStpBridgeHelloTime
vStpBridgeHelloTime.description: The value that all VLANs use for HelloTime when this bridge is acting as the root. The granularity of this timer is specified by 802.1D- 1990 to be 1 second. An agent may return a badValue error if a set is attempted to a value which is not a whole number of seconds.

vStpBridgeForwardDelay.name: vStpBridgeForwardDelay
vStpBridgeForwardDelay.description: The value that all VLANs use for ForwardDelay when this VLAN is acting as the root. Note that 802.1D-1990 specifies that the range for this parameter is related to the value of vStpBridgeMaxAge. The granularity of this timer is specified by 802.1D-1990 to be 1 second. An agent may return a badValue error if a set is attempted to a value which is not a whole number of seconds.

vStpPortTable.name: vStpPortTable
vStpPortTable.description: A table that contains port-specific information for the Spanning Tree Protocol.

vStpPortEntry.name: vStpPortEntry
vStpPortEntry.description: A list of information maintained by every port about the Spanning Tree Protocol state for that port.

vStpPortSlot.name: vStpPortSlot
vStpPortSlot.description: The slot number of the port for which this entry contains Spanning Tree Protocol management information.

vStpPortIF.name: vStpPortIF
vStpPortIF.description: The on-board interface number of the port for which this entry contains Spanning Tree Protocol management information.

vStpPortFuncTyp.name: vStpPortFuncTyp
vStpPortFuncTyp.description: The service type of the port for which this entry contains Spanning Tree Protocol management information.

vStpPortFuncTypInst.name: vStpPortFuncTypInst
vStpPortFuncTypInst.description: The service type instance of the port for which this entry contains Spanning Tree Protocol management information.

vStpPortPriority.name: vStpPortPriority
vStpPortPriority.description: The priority of this port which used originally as part of the port ID specified in 802.1D.

vStpPortState.name: vStpPortState
vStpPortState.description: The port's current state as defined by application of the Spanning Tree Protocol. This state controls what action a port takes on reception of a frame. For ports which are disabled (see vStpPortEnable), this object will have a value of disabled(1). Xylan does not support the broken(6) state as defined in RFC1493.

vStpPortEnable.name: vStpPortEnable
vStpPortEnable.description: The enabled/disabled status of the port.

vStpPortPathCost.name: vStpPortPathCost
vStpPortPathCost.description: The contribution of this port to the path cost of paths towards the spanning tree root which include this port. 802.1D-1990 recommends that the default value of this parameter be in inverse proportion to the speed of the attached LAN.

vStpPortDesignatedRoot.name: vStpPortDesignatedRoot
vStpPortDesignatedRoot.description: The unique Bridge Identifier of the Bridge recorded as the Root in the Configuration BPDUs transmitted by the Designated Bridge for the segment to which the port is attached.

vStpPortDesignatedCost.name: vStpPortDesignatedCost
vStpPortDesignatedCost.description: The path cost of the Designated Port of the segment connected to this port. This value is compared to the Root Path Cost field in received bridge PDUs.

vStpPortDesignatedBridge.name: vStpPortDesignatedBridge
vStpPortDesignatedBridge.description: The Bridge Identifier of the bridge which this port considers to be the Designated Bridge for this port's segment.

vStpPortDesignatedPtPrio.name: vStpPortDesignatedPtPrio
vStpPortDesignatedPtPrio.description: The priority portion of the port ID on the Designated Bridge for this port's segment.

vStpPortDesignatedPtSlot.name: vStpPortDesignatedPtSlot
vStpPortDesignatedPtSlot.description: The slot of the port on the Designated Bridge for this port's segment.

vStpPortDesignatedPtIF.name: vStpPortDesignatedPtIF
vStpPortDesignatedPtIF.description: The on-board interface number of the port on the Designated Bridge for this port's segment.

vStpPortDesignatedPtFuncTyp.name: vStpPortDesignatedPtFuncTyp
vStpPortDesignatedPtFuncTyp.description: The service type of the port on the Designated Bridge for this port's segment.

vStpPortDesignatedPtFuncTypInst.name: vStpPortDesignatedPtFuncTypInst
vStpPortDesignatedPtFuncTypInst.description: The service type instance of the port on the Designated Bridge for this port's segment.

vStpPortForwardTransitions.name: vStpPortForwardTransitions
vStpPortForwardTransitions.description: The number of times this port has transitioned from the Learning state to the Forwarding state.

vStpLanMode.name: vStpLanMode
vStpLanMode.description: Indicates which type of spanning tree (IEEE or IBM) is to be used for the current VLAN.

vStpStatus.name: vStpStatus
vStpStatus.description: Indicates status of spanning tree for the current VLAN.

vRipInfoTable.name: vRipInfoTable
vRipInfoTable.description: A list of Virtual LAN instances for RIP statistics.

vRipInfoEntry.name: vRipInfoEntry
vRipInfoEntry.description: A VLAN entry for RIP statistics.

vRipInfovLanNumber.name: vRipInfovLanNumber
vRipInfovLanNumber.description: The VLAN number identifying this instance. Valid range from 1 to 65535.

vRipInPkts.name: vRipInPkts
vRipInPkts.description: The number of RIP routing updates and requests received on this virtual LAN.

vRipOutPkts.name: vRipOutPkts
vRipOutPkts.description: The number of RIP routing updates and requests sent on this virtual LAN.

vRipBadSize.name: vRipBadSize
vRipBadSize.description: The number of RIP packets received on this virtual LAN whose size was incorrect.

vRipBadVersion.name: vRipBadVersion
vRipBadVersion.description: The number of RIP packets received on this virtual LAN whose version number was incorrect.

vRipNonZero.name: vRipNonZero
vRipNonZero.description: The number of RIP packets received on this virtual LAN which contained a non-zero value in one of the 'must be zero' fields.

vRipBadFamily.name: vRipBadFamily
vRipBadFamily.description: The number of RIP packets received on this virtual LAN which contained a bad value for the family type.

vRipBadMetric.name: vRipBadMetric
vRipBadMetric.description: The number of RIP packets received on this virtual LAN which contained a bad value for a route's metric.

vRipBadAddr.name: vRipBadAddr
vRipBadAddr.description: The number of RIP packets received on this virtual LAN whose host portion of the source IP address is bad.

vRipBadCommand.name: vRipBadCommand
vRipBadCommand.description: The number of RIP packets received on this virtual LAN whose command type was neither a request nor a response.

vRipTransmitsFailed.name: vRipTransmitsFailed
vRipTransmitsFailed.description: The number of RIP routing updaates or requests that the OmniSwitch was unable to transmit.

vSrTable.name: vSrTable
vSrTable.description: A table that contains information about every virtual port that is associated with this source route switch.

vSrSapFilterEnable.name: vSrSapFilterEnable
vSrSapFilterEnable.description: A scalar value to enable or disable the SAP filtering feature in this source route switch.

vSrPortEntry.name: vSrPortEntry
vSrPortEntry.description: A list of information for each virtual port of a source route switch.

vSrSlot.name: vSrSlot
vSrSlot.description: The physical slot number of the port for which this entry contains Source Route management information.

vSrInterface.name: vSrInterface
vSrInterface.description: The on-board interface number of the port for which this entry contains Source Route management information.

vSrFuncType.name: vSrFuncType
vSrFuncType.description: The service type of the port for which this entry contains Source Route management information.

vSrInstance.name: vSrInstance
vSrInstance.description: The service type instance of the port for which this entry contains Source Route management information.

vSrHopCount.name: vSrHopCount
vSrHopCount.description: The maximum number of routing descriptors allowed in an All Paths or Spanning Tree Explorer frames.

vSrLocalSegment.name: vSrLocalSegment
vSrLocalSegment.description: The segment number that uniquely identifies the segment to which this virtual port is connected. Current source routing protocols limit this value to the range: 0 through 4095. (The value 0 is used by some management applications for special test cases.) A value of 65535 signifies that no segment number is assigned to this virtual port.

vSrBridgeNum.name: vSrBridgeNum
vSrBridgeNum.description: A bridge number uniquely identifies a bridge when more than one bridge is used to span the same two segments. Current source routing protocols limit this value to the range: 0 through 15. A value of 65535 signifies that no bridge number is assigned to this bridge.

vSrVirtualRing.name: vSrVirtualRing
vSrVirtualRing.description: This is to indicate whether the ring that this virtual port is connected to is virtual or physical 1 = virtual 2 = physical.

vSrLargestFrame.name: vSrLargestFrame
vSrLargestFrame.description: The maximum size of the INFO field (LLC and above) that this virtual port can send/receive. It does not include any MAC level (framing) octets. The value of this object is used by this bridge to determine whether a modification of the LargestFrame (LF, see [14]) field of the Routing Control field of the Routing Information Field is necessary. 64 valid values are defined by the IEEE 802.5M SRT Addendum: 516, 635, 754, 873, 993, 1112, 1231, 1350, 1470, 1542, 1615, 1688, 1761, 1833, 1906, 1979, 2052, 2345, 2638, 2932, 3225, 3518, 3812, 4105, 4399, 4865, 5331, 5798, 6264, 6730, 7197, 7663, 8130, 8539, 8949, 9358, 9768, 10178, 10587, 10997, 11407, 12199, 12992, 13785, 14578, 15370, 16163, 16956, 17749, 20730, 23711, 26693, 29674, 32655, 35637, 38618, 41600, 44591, 47583, 50575, 53567, 56559, 59551, and 65535. An illegal value will not be accepted by the bridge.

vSrSTESpanMode.name: vSrSTESpanMode
vSrSTESpanMode.description: Determines how this virtual port behaves when presented with a Spanning Tree Explorer frame. The value 'disabled(2)' indicates that the virtual port will not accept or send Spanning Tree Explorer packets; any STE packets received will be silently discarded. The value 'forced(3)' indicates the virtual port will always accept and propagate Spanning Tree Explorer frames. This allows a manually configured Spanning Tree for this class of packet to be configured. Note that unlike transparent bridging, this is not catastrophic to the network if there are loops. The value 'auto-span(1)' can only be returned by a bridge that both implements the Spanning Tree Protocol and has use of the protocol enabled on this virtual port. The behavior of the virtual port for Spanning Tree Explorer frames is determined by the state of vStpPortState. If the virtual port is in the 'forwarding' state, the frame will be accepted or propagated. Otherwise, it will be silently discarded.

vSrSpecInFrames.name: vSrSpecInFrames
vSrSpecInFrames.description: The number of Specifically Routed frames, also referred to as Source Routed Frames, that have been received from this virtual port's segment.

vSrSpecOutFrames.name: vSrSpecOutFrames
vSrSpecOutFrames.description: The number of Specifically Routed frames, also referred to as Source Routed Frames, that this virtual port has transmitted on its segment.

vSrApeInFrames.name: vSrApeInFrames
vSrApeInFrames.description: The number of All Paths Explorer frames, also referred to as All Routes Explorer frames, that have been received by this virtual port from its segment.

vSrApeOutFrames.name: vSrApeOutFrames
vSrApeOutFrames.description: The number of all Paths Explorer Frames, also referred to as All Routes Explorer frames, that have been transmitted by this virtual port on its segment.

vSrSteInFrames.name: vSrSteInFrames
vSrSteInFrames.description: The number of spanning tree explorer frames that have been received by this virtual port from its segment.

vSrSteOutFrames.name: vSrSteOutFrames
vSrSteOutFrames.description: The number of spanning tree explorer frames that have been transmitted by this virtual port on its segment.

vSrInvalidRif.name: vSrInvalidRif
vSrInvalidRif.description: The number of explorer frames that have been discarded by this virtual port because the routing Information field contained an invalid value.

vSrDuplicateSegmentDiscards.name: vSrDuplicateSegmentDiscards
vSrDuplicateSegmentDiscards.description: The number of frames that have been discarded by this virtual port because the routing descriptor field contained a duplicate segment identifier.

vSrHopCountExceededDiscards.name: vSrHopCountExceededDiscards
vSrHopCountExceededDiscards.description: The number of explorer frames that have been discarded by this virtual port because the Routing Information Field has exceeded the maximum route descriptor length.

vSrDupLanIdOrTreeErrors.name: vSrDupLanIdOrTreeErrors
vSrDupLanIdOrTreeErrors.description: The number of duplicate LAN IDs or Tree errors. This helps in detection of problems in networks containing older IBM Source Routing Bridges.

vSrLanIdMismatches.name: vSrLanIdMismatches
vSrLanIdMismatches.description: The number of ARE and STE frames that were discarded because the last LAN ID in the routing information field did not equal the LAN-in ID. This error can occur in implementations which do only a LAN-in ID and Bridge Number check instead of a LAN-in ID, Bridge Number, and LAN-out ID check before they forward broadcast frames.

vSrBridgeLfMode.name: vSrBridgeLfMode
vSrBridgeLfMode.description: Indicates whether the bridge operates using older 3 bit length negotiation fields or the newer 6 bit length field in its RIF.

vSrPortType.name: vSrPortType
vSrPortType.description: Indicates whether this port is a SRT or SR only SRT = 1 SR = 2

vSrAREblock.name: vSrAREblock
vSrAREblock.description: Indicates whether this port would treat ARE frames exactly like STE frames which would be blocked if the Spanning Tree mode is blocking. 1 - this port would not block ARE. 2 - this port would block ARE.

vSrHopCountIn.name: vSrHopCountIn
vSrHopCountIn.description: The maximum number of routing descriptors allowed in an inbound All Paths or Spanning Tree Explorer frames.

vSrSapDenyFilter1.name: vSrSapDenyFilter1
vSrSapDenyFilter1.description: Packets with this SAP value are to be discarded.

vSrSapDenyFilter2.name: vSrSapDenyFilter2
vSrSapDenyFilter2.description: Packets with this SAP value are to be discarded.

vSrSapPermitFilter1.name: vSrSapPermitFilter1
vSrSapPermitFilter1.description: Packets without this SAP value are to be discarded.

vSrSapPermitFilter2.name: vSrSapPermitFilter2
vSrSapPermitFilter2.description: Packets without this SAP value are to be discarded.

vTrunkingServicesTable.name: vTrunkingServicesTable
vTrunkingServicesTable.description: A list of commands to add or remove Virtual LANs from a trunking service.

vTrunkingServicesSlot.name: vTrunkingServicesSlot
vTrunkingServicesSlot.description: The slot number (1-based) of the physical port providing the trunking service.

vTrunkingServicesStation.name: vTrunkingServicesStation
vTrunkingServicesStation.description: The station number (1-based) within the physical port providing the trunking service.

vTrunkingServicesDescription.name: vTrunkingServicesDescription
vTrunkingServicesDescription.description: A description of the trunking service being provided.

vTrunkingServicesBridgeID.name: vTrunkingServicesBridgeID
vTrunkingServicesBridgeID.description: The VLAN ID of the Virtual Bridge port for the given trunking service. A value of 0 means that the Virtual Bridge port does not exist.

vTrunkingVlanTable.name: vTrunkingVlanTable
vTrunkingVlanTable.description: A list of commands to add or remove Virtual LANs from a trunking service.

vTrunkingSlot.name: vTrunkingSlot
vTrunkingSlot.description: The slot number (1-based) of the physical port providing the trunking service.

vTrunkingStation.name: vTrunkingStation
vTrunkingStation.description: The station number (1-based) within the physical port providing the trunking service.

vTrunkingLanNumber.name: vTrunkingLanNumber
vTrunkingLanNumber.description: The VLAN ID to be added to or removed from the given trunking service.

vTrunkingCommand.name: vTrunkingCommand
vTrunkingCommand.description: The command to either add or remove the specified VLAN ID from the given trunking service.

atportRuleTable.name: atportRuleTable
atportRuleTable.description: This table is used to configure a Port Rule for a VLAN. The VLAN has to be created before any rule can be configured for it.

atportRuleEntry.name: atportRuleEntry
atportRuleEntry.description: An entry in the atportRuleTable. Each entry in this table identifies exactly one port that is part of the VLAN definition. Hence all the entries of this table with the same GroupId and VLANId collectively define one VLAN which is based on a Port Rule. A specific port can be included in definition of more than one vlan as long as those two vlans are part of the same VLAN group. That is to say, a port can belong to more than one vlan but can be part of atmost one VLAN group.

atportRuleGroupId.name: atportRuleGroupId
atportRuleGroupId.description: This object indicates the VLAN Group in which the VLAN defined by this rule is.

atportRuleVLANId.name: atportRuleVLANId
atportRuleVLANId.description: This object is the VLAN defined by this port-rule.

atportRuleIdx.name: atportRuleIdx
atportRuleIdx.description: This object indicates the exact port-rule for this VLAN. There can be more than one port-rule defined for this VLAN. This object identifies the port rule of which the port is part of. When creating a VLAN using this table, this value should be set to 0 to indicate that this is a new port rule. If the port rule needs to be modified, then this object will be the port rule to modify.

atportRulePortId.name: atportRulePortId
atportRulePortId.description: This object defines the Virtual port that is part of this PORT rule. The first octet gives the slot number on which the port resides, the second being the physical interface, third octet being the service and the fourth being the instance of the service.

atportRulePortState.name: atportRulePortState
atportRulePortState.description: This object indicates whether this perticular rule is being used as part this VLANs definition. When set to disabled, this rule is not used as part of this vlans definition.

atMacRuleTable.name: atMacRuleTable
atMacRuleTable.description: This table is used to configure an Auto-Tracker VLAN based on a MAC Rule. Note the a VLAN created by using this table will not be enabled until the atVLANAdminStatus in the atVLANControlTable is not set to enabled.

atMacRuleEntry.name: atMacRuleEntry
atMacRuleEntry.description: An entry in the atMacRuleTable. Each entry in this table identifies exactly one MAC address. All entries in this table with the same GroupId and VLANId collectively define a VLAN.

atMacRuleGroupId.name: atMacRuleGroupId
atMacRuleGroupId.description: This object indicates the VLAN Group in which the VLAN defined by this rule is.

atMacRuleVLANId.name: atMacRuleVLANId
atMacRuleVLANId.description: This object is the VLAN Id for this MAC-rule based vlan.

atMacRuleIndex.name: atMacRuleIndex
atMacRuleIndex.description: The rule of which this MAC address list is part of. When creating a VLAN, this object must be set to 0.

atMacRuleMacAddress.name: atMacRuleMacAddress
atMacRuleMacAddress.description: This object gives the value of the MAC address that is part of the MAC rule definition.

atMacRuleMacAddressState.name: atMacRuleMacAddressState
atMacRuleMacAddressState.description: This object indicates whether this perticular rule is being used as part this VLANs definition. When set to disabled, this rule is not used as part of this vlans definition.

atProtoRuleTable.name: atProtoRuleTable
atProtoRuleTable.description: This table is used to configure an Auto-Tracker VLAN based on Protocol Rule. Note that any VLAN created using this table will not be enabled until the atVLANAdminStatus in the atVLANControlTable is not set to enabled.

atProtoRuleGroupId.name: atProtoRuleGroupId
atProtoRuleGroupId.description: This object indicates the VLAN Group in which the VLAN defined by this rule is defined.

atProtoRuleVLANId.name: atProtoRuleVLANId
atProtoRuleVLANId.description: This object is the VLAN Id defined by this Protocol-rule.

atProtoRuleIndex.name: atProtoRuleIndex
atProtoRuleIndex.description: This object specifies the exact protocol rule for this VLAN. On creating a VLAN based on protocol rule, this object must be set to 0.

atProtoRule.name: atProtoRule
atProtoRule.description: This object is an octet string of length 5 bytes. This object specifies the protocol type that defines this vlan. The values for the different protocols are: IP - first byte = 1, IPX - first byte = 2, AppleTalk - first byte = 3, DECNet - first byte = 4, Note that, in case of IP, ARP is included as IP and need not be specified explicitly. Similarly when AppleTalk is chosen both DDP and AARP are included. If any other protocol is used, it can be defined either by using Ether-type - first byte = 5 specifying its ether-type, second and third byte = ether-type value in hex. DSAP and SSAP - first byte = 6 specifying that its SAP type second byte = DSAP, third byte = SSAP in hex. SNAP Type - first byte = 7 specifying its SNAP second through sixth byte = snap value in hex.

atProtoRuleStatus.name: atProtoRuleStatus
atProtoRuleStatus.description: This object indicates whether this perticular rule is being used as part this VLANs definition. When set to disabled, this rule is not used as part of this vlans definition.

atNetRuleTable.name: atNetRuleTable
atNetRuleTable.description: This table is used to configure an Auto-Tracker VLAN based on Net Addr Rule. Note that any VLAN created using this table will not be enabled until the atVLANAdminStatus in the atVLANControlTable is not set to enabled.

atNetRuleEntry.name: atNetRuleEntry
atNetRuleEntry.description: An entry in the atNetRuleTable. A VLAN can be defined using exaclty one address only except in the case of IPX where it could either be a Network number or the encapsulation.

atNetRuleGroupId.name: atNetRuleGroupId
atNetRuleGroupId.description: This object indicates the VLAN Group in which this VLAN is defined.

atNetRuleVLANId.name: atNetRuleVLANId
atNetRuleVLANId.description: This object is the VLAN Id for this NetAddr-rule based vlan.

atNetRuleIndex.name: atNetRuleIndex
atNetRuleIndex.description: This object specifies the exact Network Address rule for this VLAN. When creating a VLAN using the Network Address rule, this object must be set to 0.

atNetRuleProtocolId.name: atNetRuleProtocolId
atNetRuleProtocolId.description: This object indicates which protocols Network Address is used to define this VLAN.

atNetRuleNetAddr.name: atNetRuleNetAddr
atNetRuleNetAddr.description: This object gives the network address that defines this vlan. If the protocol is IP, this object contains the four bytes of IP address followed by four bytes of IP Subnet Mask. If the protocol is IPX, this object contains the four bytes of Network Number followed by one byte of encapsulation type used on that network. The values for the encapsulation types are: byte 5 = 1 - IPX 802.3 encapsulation byte 5 = 2 - IPX Ethernet2 encapsulation byte 5 = 3 - IPX LLC encapsulation byte 5 = 4 - IPX SNAP encapsulation If the protocol is DECNet, this object contains the one byte of DEC area.

atNetRuleStatus.name: atNetRuleStatus
atNetRuleStatus.description: This object indicates whether this perticular rule is being used as part this VLANs definition. When set to disabled, this rule is not used as part of this vlans definition.

atUserRuleTable.name: atUserRuleTable
atUserRuleTable.description: This table is used to configure an Auto-Tracker VLAN based on a User Defined Rule.Note that any VLAN created using this table will not be enabled until the atVLANAdminStatus in the atVLANControlTable is not set to enabled.

atUserRuleEntry.name: atUserRuleEntry
atUserRuleEntry.description: An entry in the atUserRuleTable. A VLAN can be defined by more than one rule. In that case, the device will belong to that VLAN if it matches atleast one of the rules defined for that VLAN.

atUserRuleGroupId.name: atUserRuleGroupId
atUserRuleGroupId.description: This object indicates the VLAN Group in which this VLAN is defined.

atUserRuleVLANId.name: atUserRuleVLANId
atUserRuleVLANId.description: This object is the VLAN Id for this User-rule based vlan.

atUserRuleIndex.name: atUserRuleIndex
atUserRuleIndex.description: This object indicates the exact User defined rule for this VLAN. When creating a VLAN using the user defined rules, this object must be set to 0.

atUserRuleOffset.name: atUserRuleOffset
atUserRuleOffset.description: This object defines the offset into a frame where the pattern to match is located. This offset is relative to the start of the MAC header.

atUserRuleValue.name: atUserRuleValue
atUserRuleValue.description: This object defines the value of the pattern to match in a frame. The maximum length of this value can be 8 octets and the associated mask should have the same length as this object.

atUserRuleMask.name: atUserRuleMask
atUserRuleMask.description: This object defines the mask for the pattern to match. The Mask can be upto 8 bytes long but has to be of the same length as the Value.

atUserRuleStatus.name: atUserRuleStatus
atUserRuleStatus.description: This object indicates whether this perticular rule is being used as part this VLANs definition. When set to disabled, this rule is not used as part of this vlans definition.

atVLANRuleSumTable.name: atVLANRuleSumTable
atVLANRuleSumTable.description: This table provides the summary of vlan rule configuration.

atVLANRuleSumEntry.name: atVLANRuleSumEntry
atVLANRuleSumEntry.description: An entry in the vlan summary table.

atVLANRuleSumGroupId.name: atVLANRuleSumGroupId
atVLANRuleSumGroupId.description: The group to which the VLAN belongs.

atVLANRuleSumVLANId.name: atVLANRuleSumVLANId
atVLANRuleSumVLANId.description: The VLAN Id for this rule is defined.

atVLANRuleIndex.name: atVLANRuleIndex
atVLANRuleIndex.description: The exact rule identifier for this rule.

atVLANRuleSubIndex.name: atVLANRuleSubIndex
atVLANRuleSubIndex.description: In case a VLAN is defined using multiple instances of the same type of rule, this object identifies the exact instance of that type of rule. This object could then be used along with the group and vlanid to get the complete definition of this rule from the appropriate rule table.

atVLANRuleType.name: atVLANRuleType
atVLANRuleType.description: The type of rule. This object can then be used to decide which table to lookup for the complete definition of the rule.

atVLANControlTable.name: atVLANControlTable
atVLANControlTable.description: This table gives the control information about all Auto-Tracker VLANs.

atVLANControlEntry.name: atVLANControlEntry
atVLANControlEntry.description: An entry in the control table.

atVLANGroupId.name: atVLANGroupId
atVLANGroupId.description: This is the VLAN group to which the VLAN belongs.

atVLANId.name: atVLANId
atVLANId.description: The VLAN id for this VLAN.

atVLANAdminStatus.name: atVLANAdminStatus
atVLANAdminStatus.description: The Admin status of the VLAN. If set to disabled, any rules configured for this vlan will no longer be used and their status will be changed to disabled.

atVLANOperStatus.name: atVLANOperStatus
atVLANOperStatus.description: The operation status of this vlan. If there any devices learnt by this system on this vlan, the operation status of the vlan is said to be active.

atDefaultVlan.name: atDefaultVlan
atDefaultVlan.description: When set to on, it allows devices to be assigned to the default vlan, else if it set to off, such devices are not assigned to any vlan, thereby preventing them from communicating to other devices.

atmcportRuleTable.name: atmcportRuleTable
atmcportRuleTable.description: This table is used to configure a Port Rule for a VLAN. The VLAN has to be created before any rule can be configured for it.

atmcportRuleEntry.name: atmcportRuleEntry
atmcportRuleEntry.description: An entry in the atportRuleTable. Each entry in this table identifies exactly one port that is part of the VLAN definition. Hence all the entries of this table with the same GroupId and VLANId collectively define one VLAN which is based on a Port Rule. A specific port can be included in definition of more than one vlan as long as those two vlans are part of the same VLAN group. That is to say, a port can belong to more than one vlan but can be part of atmost one VLAN group.

atmcportRuleGroupId.name: atmcportRuleGroupId
atmcportRuleGroupId.description: This object indicates the VLAN Group in which the VLAN defined by this rule is.

atmcportRuleVLANId.name: atmcportRuleVLANId
atmcportRuleVLANId.description: This object is the VLAN defined by this port-rule.

atmcportRuleIdx.name: atmcportRuleIdx
atmcportRuleIdx.description: This object indicates the exact port-rule for this VLAN. There can be more than one port-rule defined for this VLAN. This object identifies the port rule of which the port is part of. When creating a VLAN using this table, this value should be set to 0 to indicate that this is a new port rule. If the port rule needs to be modified, then this object will be the port rule to modify.

atmcportRulePortId.name: atmcportRulePortId
atmcportRulePortId.description: This object defines the Virtual port that is part of this PORT rule. The first octet gives the slot number on which the port resides, the second being the physical interface, third octet being the service and the fourth being the instance of the service.

atmcportRulePortState.name: atmcportRulePortState
atmcportRulePortState.description: This object determines whether the port is being added or deleted from this port rule definition.

atmcMacRuleTable.name: atmcMacRuleTable
atmcMacRuleTable.description: This table is used to configure an Auto-Tracker VLAN based on a MAC Rule. Note the a VLAN created by using this table will not be enabled until the atVLANAdminStatus in the atVLANControlTable is not set to enabled.

atmcMacRuleEntry.name: atmcMacRuleEntry
atmcMacRuleEntry.description: An entry in the atmcMacRuleTable. Each entry in this table identifies exactly one MAC address. All entries in this table with the same GroupId and VLANId collectively define a VLAN.

atmcMacRuleGroupId.name: atmcMacRuleGroupId
atmcMacRuleGroupId.description: This object indicates the VLAN Group in which the VLAN defined by this rule is.

atmcMacRuleVLANId.name: atmcMacRuleVLANId
atmcMacRuleVLANId.description: This object is the VLAN Id for this MAC-rule based vlan.

atmcMacRuleIndex.name: atmcMacRuleIndex
atmcMacRuleIndex.description: The rule of which this MAC address list is part of. When creating a VLAN, this object must be set to 0.

atmcMacRuleMacAddress.name: atmcMacRuleMacAddress
atmcMacRuleMacAddress.description: This object gives the value of the MAC address that is part of the MAC rule definition.

atmcMacRuleMacAddressState.name: atmcMacRuleMacAddressState
atmcMacRuleMacAddressState.description: This object determines if the MAC address is included in the VLAN definition. If the object is set to disabled, the MAC address is removed from the VLAN definition.

atMcastRuleTable.name: atMcastRuleTable
atMcastRuleTable.description: This table is used to configure MCAST Rules for a VLAN.

atMcastRuleEntry.name: atMcastRuleEntry
atMcastRuleEntry.description: An entry in the MCAST Rule table.

atMcastRuleGroupId.name: atMcastRuleGroupId
atMcastRuleGroupId.description: The group in which this rule is defined.

atMcastRuleVLANId.name: atMcastRuleVLANId
atMcastRuleVLANId.description: The VLAN for which this rule is defined.

atMcastRuleIndex.name: atMcastRuleIndex
atMcastRuleIndex.description: The rule index ( a vlan can have multiple rules defined ) which exactly identifies this rule.

atMcastRuleMacAddress.name: atMcastRuleMacAddress
atMcastRuleMacAddress.description: The Multicast MAC Address that makes up this rule.

atMcastRuleMacAddressState.name: atMcastRuleMacAddressState
atMcastRuleMacAddressState.description: The admin-state of this multicast mac address.

atmcVLANRuleSumTable.name: atmcVLANRuleSumTable
atmcVLANRuleSumTable.description: This table provides the summary of vlan rule configuration.

atmcVLANRuleSumEntry.name: atmcVLANRuleSumEntry
atmcVLANRuleSumEntry.description: An entry in the vlan summary table.

atmcVLANRuleSumGroupId.name: atmcVLANRuleSumGroupId
atmcVLANRuleSumGroupId.description: The group to which the VLAN belongs.

atmcVLANRuleSumVLANId.name: atmcVLANRuleSumVLANId
atmcVLANRuleSumVLANId.description: The VLAN Id for this rule is defined.

atmcVLANRuleIndex.name: atmcVLANRuleIndex
atmcVLANRuleIndex.description: The exact rule identifier for this rule.

atmcVLANRuleSubIndex.name: atmcVLANRuleSubIndex
atmcVLANRuleSubIndex.description: In case a VLAN is defined using multiple instances of the same type of rule, this object identifies the exact instance of that type of rule. This object could then be used along with the group and vlanid to get the complete definition of this rule from the appropriate rule table.

atmcVLANRuleType.name: atmcVLANRuleType
atmcVLANRuleType.description: The type of rule. This object can then be used to decide which table to lookup for the complete definition of the rule.

atmcVLANControlTable.name: atmcVLANControlTable
atmcVLANControlTable.description: This table gives the control information about all Auto-Tracker VLANs.

atmcVLANControlEntry.name: atmcVLANControlEntry
atmcVLANControlEntry.description: An entry in the control table.

atmcVLANGroupId.name: atmcVLANGroupId
atmcVLANGroupId.description: This is the VLAN group to which the VLAN belongs.

atmcVLANId.name: atmcVLANId
atmcVLANId.description: The VLAN id for this VLAN.

atmcVLANAdminStatus.name: atmcVLANAdminStatus
atmcVLANAdminStatus.description: The Admin status of the VLAN. If set to disabled, any rules configured for this vlan will no longer be used and their status will be changed to disabled.

atmcVLANOperStatus.name: atmcVLANOperStatus
atmcVLANOperStatus.description: The operation status of this vlan. If there any devices learnt by this system on this vlan, the operation status of the vlan is said to be active.

gmAutoServiceGroupId.name: gmAutoServiceGroupId
gmAutoServiceGroupId.description: Group for which this service is configured

gmAutoServicePrimarySlot.name: gmAutoServicePrimarySlot
gmAutoServicePrimarySlot.description: Primary slot on which this service will be activated.

gmAutoServicePrimaryPort.name: gmAutoServicePrimaryPort
gmAutoServicePrimaryPort.description: Primary port on which this service will be activated.

gmAutoServiceIndex.name: gmAutoServiceIndex
gmAutoServiceIndex.description: Service index associated with this service

gmAutoServiceType.name: gmAutoServiceType
gmAutoServiceType.description: Type of this service - currently only lane is supported and this object should have a value of 1.

gmAutoServiceName.name: gmAutoServiceName
gmAutoServiceName.description: The name of the service. In case of LANE, this is the elan name.

gmAutoServiceSecondarySlot.name: gmAutoServiceSecondarySlot
gmAutoServiceSecondarySlot.description: Secondary slot on which this service will be activated.

gmAutoServiceSecondaryPort.name: gmAutoServiceSecondaryPort
gmAutoServiceSecondaryPort.description: Secondary port on which this service will be activated.

gmAutoServiceAdminState.name: gmAutoServiceAdminState
gmAutoServiceAdminState.description: The admin state of this service

gmAutoServiceActiveSlot.name: gmAutoServiceActiveSlot
gmAutoServiceActiveSlot.description: Slot on the which the service is currently active.

gmAutoServiceActivePort.name: gmAutoServiceActivePort
gmAutoServiceActivePort.description: Physical Port on the which the service is currently active.

gmAutoServiceNumber.name: gmAutoServiceNumber
gmAutoServiceNumber.description: Service number assigned by the switch when this service is activated.

gmAutoServiceTranslations.name: gmAutoServiceTranslations
gmAutoServiceTranslations.description: This parameter controls whether frame translations will be exercised for this lane service once activated.

atBindRuleEntry.name: atBindRuleEntry
atBindRuleEntry.description: An entry in the Binding Rule Table.

atBindRuleGroupId.name: atBindRuleGroupId
atBindRuleGroupId.description: The group id of the vlan for which this rule is configured.

atBindRuleVlanId.name: atBindRuleVlanId
atBindRuleVlanId.description: The vlan id for which this rule is configured.

atBindRuleIndex.name: atBindRuleIndex
atBindRuleIndex.description: The index which uniquely identifies this rule for this vlan.

atBindRulePortId.name: atBindRulePortId
atBindRulePortId.description: The port ( slot/intf/srvc/inst) for which this binding is configured.

atBindRuleIPAddress.name: atBindRuleIPAddress
atBindRuleIPAddress.description: The IP address for which this binding is configured.

atBindRuleMacAddress.name: atBindRuleMacAddress
atBindRuleMacAddress.description: The mac address for which this binding is configured.

atBindRuleProtocol.name: atBindRuleProtocol
atBindRuleProtocol.description: The protocol for which this binding is configured.

atBindRuleStatus.name: atBindRuleStatus
atBindRuleStatus.description: The admin status for this rule.

gmGroupListTable.name: gmGroupListTable
gmGroupListTable.description: This table lists the groups on a port.

gmGroupListEntry.name: gmGroupListEntry
gmGroupListEntry.description: An entry in the Group List table.

gmGroupListPortSlot.name: gmGroupListPortSlot
gmGroupListPortSlot.description: The slot id of the port for which the group list is requested.

gmGroupListPortInterface.name: gmGroupListPortInterface
gmGroupListPortInterface.description: The physical port number for which the group list is requested.

gmGroupListGroupId.name: gmGroupListGroupId
gmGroupListGroupId.description: One of the Groups to which the port belongs.

atDHCPportRuleTable.name: atDHCPportRuleTable
atDHCPportRuleTable.description: This table is used to configure a Port Rule for a VLAN. The VLAN has to be created before any rule can be configured for it.

atDHCPportRuleEntry.name: atDHCPportRuleEntry
atDHCPportRuleEntry.description: An entry in the atDHCPportRuleTable. Each entry in this table identifies exactly one port that is part of the VLAN definition. Hence all the entries of this table with the same GroupId and VLANId collectively define one VLAN which is based on a Port Rule. A specific port can be included in definition of more than one vlan as long as those two vlans are part of the same VLAN group. That is to say, a port can belong to more than one vlan but can be part of atmost one VLAN group.

atDHCPportRuleGroupId.name: atDHCPportRuleGroupId
atDHCPportRuleGroupId.description: This object indicates the VLAN Group in which the VLAN defined by this rule is.

atDHCPportRuleVLANId.name: atDHCPportRuleVLANId
atDHCPportRuleVLANId.description: This object is the VLAN defined by this port-rule.

atDHCPportRuleIdx.name: atDHCPportRuleIdx
atDHCPportRuleIdx.description: This object indicates the exact port-rule for this VLAN. There can be more than one port-rule defined for this VLAN. This object identifies the port rule of which the port is part of. When creating a VLAN using this table, this value should be set to 0 to indicate that this is a new port rule. If the port rule needs to be modified, then this object will be the port rule to modify.

atDHCPportRulePortId.name: atDHCPportRulePortId
atDHCPportRulePortId.description: This object defines the Virtual port that is part of this PORT rule. The first octet gives the slot number on which the port resides, the second being the physical interface, third octet being the service and the fourth being the instance of the service.

atDHCPportRulePortState.name: atDHCPportRulePortState
atDHCPportRulePortState.description: This object determines whether the port is being added or deleted from this port rule definition.

atDHCPMacRuleTable.name: atDHCPMacRuleTable
atDHCPMacRuleTable.description: This table is used to configure an Auto-Tracker VLAN based on a MAC Rule. Note the a VLAN created by using this table will not be enabled until the atVLANAdminStatus in the atVLANControlTable is not set to enabled.

atDHCPMacRuleEntry.name: atDHCPMacRuleEntry
atDHCPMacRuleEntry.description: An entry in the atDHCPMacRuleTable. Each entry in this table identifies exactly one MAC address. All entries in this table with the same GroupId and VLANId collectively define a VLAN.

atDHCPMacRuleGroupId.name: atDHCPMacRuleGroupId
atDHCPMacRuleGroupId.description: This object indicates the VLAN Group in which the VLAN defined by this rule is.

atDHCPMacRuleVLANId.name: atDHCPMacRuleVLANId
atDHCPMacRuleVLANId.description: This object is the VLAN Id for this MAC-rule based vlan.

atDHCPMacRuleIndex.name: atDHCPMacRuleIndex
atDHCPMacRuleIndex.description: The rule of which this MAC address list is part of. When creating a VLAN, this object must be set to 0.

atDHCPMacRuleMacAddress.name: atDHCPMacRuleMacAddress
atDHCPMacRuleMacAddress.description: This object gives the value of the MAC address that is part of the MAC rule definition.

atDHCPMacRuleMacAddressState.name: atDHCPMacRuleMacAddressState
atDHCPMacRuleMacAddressState.description: This object determines if the MAC address is included in the VLAN definition. If the object is set to disabled, the MAC address is removed from the VLAN definition.

groupMobilityStatus.name: groupMobilityStatus
groupMobilityStatus.description: This object can used to configure the global status of group-mobility feature on the switch.

gmMoveToDefGroup.name: gmMoveToDefGroup
gmMoveToDefGroup.description: When this object is set on, the switch will remove the port of out of a mobile group when the last device in that group learnt on that port ages out due to inactivity. When it is set to off, the port will remain in such a group, even if all macs leant on that port in that group age out.

gmDefGroup.name: gmDefGroup
gmDefGroup.description: When this object is set to on, the switch will assign the port's default group id to all such devices which are learned and do not match any policies for mobile groups. If it is set to off, such devices will get assigned to no groups and the traffic they send will be discarded by the switch.

atvIPRouterTable.name: atvIPRouterTable
atvIPRouterTable.description: A list of Virtual Router instances in this physical OmniSwitch.

atvIPRouterVLanGroup.name: atvIPRouterVLanGroup
atvIPRouterVLanGroup.description: VLAN Group ID for this atvIPRouterEntry instance.

atvIPRouterVLan.name: atvIPRouterVLan
atvIPRouterVLan.description: Auto Tracker VLAN Id for this router port instance.

atvIPRouterProtocol.name: atvIPRouterProtocol
atvIPRouterProtocol.description: The routing protocol(s) for this virtual router port. Each IP router port can carry one or more routing protocols. This will be represented by the logical ORing of each protocol number. Which are: ipOther(1), ipRip(2), ipEgp(4), ipGgp(8), ipHello(16), ipIs-is(32), ipEs-is(64), ipCiscoIgrp(128), ipBbnSpfIgp(256), ipOigp(512)

atvIPRouterNetAddress.name: atvIPRouterNetAddress
atvIPRouterNetAddress.description: The IP network address for this virtual bridge instance for the purpose of allowing access from the external network management system.

atvIPRouterSubNetMask.name: atvIPRouterSubNetMask
atvIPRouterSubNetMask.description: The IP network subnet mask for this virtual bridge instance for the purpose of allowing access from the external network management system.

atvIPRouterBcastAddress.name: atvIPRouterBcastAddress
atvIPRouterBcastAddress.description: The IP broadcast address for this virtual bridge instance for the purpose of allowing access from the external network management system.

atvIPRouterDescription.name: atvIPRouterDescription
atvIPRouterDescription.description: Textual description of the router instance.

atvIPRouterAdmStatus.name: atvIPRouterAdmStatus
atvIPRouterAdmStatus.description: The particular routing environment can be enable(2) or disable(1) (or delete (3)) upon user's request.

atvIPRouterOperStatus.name: atvIPRouterOperStatus
atvIPRouterOperStatus.description: Provide operating status of a particular router envirnment.

atvIPRouterFramingType.name: atvIPRouterFramingType
atvIPRouterFramingType.description: Provides the ability to set the outbound frame type for IP traffic. The default frame type is Ethernet 2. If the frame type is incompatible with the transmitting media, appropriate translation will be performed at egress.

atvIPRouterRipConfigMode.name: atvIPRouterRipConfigMode
atvIPRouterRipConfigMode.description: RIP's operational mode. 'silent' means that RIP listens for routing updates but does not send them. 'deaf' means that RIP sends routing updates but not listen to them. 'active' means that RIP both sends and receives routing updates, and 'inactive' means that RIP is not operational on the given virtual LAN. The default is 'simple'.

atvIPRouterRelayServicesFwd.name: atvIPRouterRelayServicesFwd
atvIPRouterRelayServicesFwd.description: Each of the 8 least significant bits are assigned to a UDP Relay service as follows: 01H - bootp (Not currently allowed) 02H - NBNS 04H - NBDD 08H - Gen1 10H - Gen2 20H - Gen3 40H - Gen4 80H - Gen5 A set bit indicates that packets are being forwarded to this vlan for the service corresponding to the bit. Use bit 15 to indicate that a UDP Relay Service should be unset and packets should not be forwarded to this vlan. 8001H - bootp (Not currently allowed) 8002H - NBNS 8004H - NBDD 8008H - Gen1 8010H - Gen2 8020H - Gen3 8040H - Gen4 8080H - Gen5

atvIPXRouterTable.name: atvIPXRouterTable
atvIPXRouterTable.description: A list of Virtual Router instances in this physical OmniSwitch.

atvIPXRouterVLanGroup.name: atvIPXRouterVLanGroup
atvIPXRouterVLanGroup.description: VLAN Group ID for this vIPXRouterEntry instance.

atvIPXRouterVLan.name: atvIPXRouterVLan
atvIPXRouterVLan.description: VLAN ID for this vIPXRouterEntry instance.

atvIPXRouterProtocol.name: atvIPXRouterProtocol
atvIPXRouterProtocol.description: The routing protocol(s) for this virtual router port. Each IPX router port can carry one or more routing protocols. This will be represented by the logical ORing of each protocol number. Which are: ipxOther(1), ipxRip(2), ipxSap(4)

atvIPXRouterNetAddress.name: atvIPXRouterNetAddress
atvIPXRouterNetAddress.description: The IPX network address for this virtual bridge.

atvIPXRouterFramingType.name: atvIPXRouterFramingType
atvIPXRouterFramingType.description: Provides the ability to set the outbound frame type for IPX traffic. The default frame type is 802.2 Novell Raw. If the frame type is incompatible with the transmitting media, appropriate translation will be performed at egress.

atvIPXRouterDescription.name: atvIPXRouterDescription
atvIPXRouterDescription.description: Textual description of the router instance.

atvIPXRouterAdmStatus.name: atvIPXRouterAdmStatus
atvIPXRouterAdmStatus.description: The particular routing environment can be enabled(2) or disabled(1) upon user's request.

atvIPXRouterOperStatus.name: atvIPXRouterOperStatus
atvIPXRouterOperStatus.description: Provide operating status of a particular router envirnment.

atvIPXSrcRteType.name: atvIPXSrcRteType
atvIPXSrcRteType.description: Provide the ability to set the type of source routing broadcasts between AllRoutesExplorer(0) and SpanningTreeExplorer(1).

qGroupMode.name: qGroupMode
qGroupMode.description: gstsxylan(1) indicates spanning tree support on a gigabit port by proprietary mode and gstsieee(2) indicates spanning tree on a gigabit port by IEEE mode, msts(3) indicates multiple spanning tree support on a 10/100 Mammoth Ethernet port, and ssts(4) indicates single spanning tree support on a 10/100 Mammoth Ethernet port.
